ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would any architecture and art history student to take this course. It challenges many assumptions and helps one create new perspectives on the emergence of post-modernism.

Yes, I would definitely recommend the course... I would take any class with JD, one of those people who make going to a place like Yale worth it... Course was an introduction to some major trends in intellectual thought from mid-century... Super helpful for people who study 20th century American literature and culture to become familiar with Friedman, Goffman, Rawls, Lynch, etc

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: it exposed me to a variety of frameworks relating to the emergence of postmodernism in different fields, art history, linguistics, media, and sociology.

I definitely have a better sense of what postmodern intellectual history might look like, a new sense of what a more exciting historicism might look like... I enjoy JD's sensibility / approach to texts very much... the melding of history, theory, sociology, intellectual history, and really good readings of films, novels, works of art, all with the same sort of critical distance and sense of curiosity and fun... definitely an attractive model to try to imitate
